intro: Pilosella lygodes, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Pilosella lygodes has small, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine white or grayish pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, contributing to its ecological role in pollination and habitat support.
